availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William C. Kinsolving (Caldwell co farmhand and csa soldier (2nd mt inf))

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmhand and soldier. Virginia native. Son of James Kinsolving and Margaret Kinsolving. Student in Crittenden County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmhand in Princeton in 1860. Served in the 3rd Kentucky Infantry Regiment (C.S.A.) as a corporal and sergeant from August 19, 1861 to May 16, 1865. Captured at Corinth, Massachusetts, in October 1862. Paroled on May 16, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Crittenden County, District 2, p. 273A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 88.
Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 0092.
